concept_data.title: justice and home affairs
concept_data.preferred_term: area of freedom, security and justice

summary: The concept of "justice and home affairs" redirects to the preferred term "area of freedom, security and justice" (AFSJ), which governs the EU's legal framework for ensuring safety and rights across member states. This area develops policies to fight crime, terrorism, and ensure the enforceability of judgments across borders. It encompasses various instruments, such as Eurodac for asylum seekers and the Schengen Information System (SIS) for cross-border cooperation. The AFSJ recognizes the need for unity among nationals, reflecting the importance of victims' rights and redress mechanisms. It also addresses issues related to residence, parental rights, and matrimonial matters, ensuring comprehensive legal protection for all individuals.
